etymology.description: 行动(mobile; to move) + 电源(power source) = portable power supply (power bank).
etymology.interpretation: Combines mobility with a power source, referring to a portable battery pack for charging devices on the go. Emphasizes use while moving or away from fixed outlets.
etymology.simplification: “动” simplified from “動” and “电” from “電” to reduce strokes in PRC reforms; “行” and “源” unchanged.

parts.english: to go; to travel; to carry out; all right/OK
to move; movement; to stir/touch; to set in motion

examples.chinese: 我随身带着行动电源(我隨身帶著行動電源)，可以随时给手机充电(可以隨時給手機充電)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ suíshēn dàizhe xíngdòng diànyuán, kěyǐ suíshí gěi shǒujī chōngdiàn.
examples.english: I carry a power bank with me so I can charge my phone anytime.

examples.chinese: 出差时(出差時)，行动电源在火车上很有用(行動電源在火車上很有用)。
examples.pinyin: Chūchāi shí, xíngdòng diànyuán zài huǒchē shàng hěn yǒuyòng.
examples.english: On business trips, a power bank is very useful on the train.

examples.chinese: 这个行动电源容量一万毫安时(這個行動電源容量一萬毫安時)，能充三次(能充三次)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège xíngdòng diànyuán róngliàng yī wàn háo'ānshí, néng chōng sān cì.
examples.english: This power bank has a 10,000 mAh capacity and can charge three times.
